summary: This bill, the Commission to Study Acts of Antisemitism in the United States Act, establishes a commission to investigate and report on antisemitism in the U.S. The commission will examine the facts and causes of antisemitism, evaluate evidence from government sources, and make recommendations for legislation or administrative action to the President and Congress. The commission will be composed of eight members appointed by congressional leaders and is required to submit a report within one year of the bill's enactment.
